candidates.title: Katy Perry Reveals Penchant for Cannibalism?
candidates.content:
Claim:
In an interview with a French radio station, Katy Perry revealed a preference for eating human meat.
On 1 November 2017, the notorious fake news web site Your News Wire falsely reported that the singer Katy Perry had admitted her preference for human meat in an interview with French radio:
Human flesh is the finest meat in the world, according to Katy Perry, who puts the exquisite flavor of the meat down to the taboo nature of the product and the fact that forbidden pleasures are always the most delicious.
Going as far as to claim that cannibalism is way more popular than you might think, Katy Perry also claimed that so many people in Hollywood tell you that human meat is the best, the absolute best, meat in the world.
These quotes were entirely fabricated and appeared to play on the music video for Perry's recent single "Bon Apptit," which used special effects to show her being "prepared" by a group of male chefs before being cooked in various ways:
The article also referenced a long-standing conspiracy theory about Satanist/Illuminati infiltration of Hollywood which includes associated occult rituals, falsely asserting Perry told a French radio station that "There is a group of old Hollywood guys who have an annual dinner party where the main dish is human."
candidates.description: A disreputable web site adds to its archive of distasteful and entirely fabricated stories.

result.explanation: The news caption is False.  Snopes.com explicitly debunks the claim that Katy Perry made the statement about human flesh being the finest meat.  The source identifies the quote as entirely fabricated and part of a false report by Your News Wire.
result.supporting_points: Source 1: Snopes.com article explicitly states that the quote about Katy Perry and human flesh is entirely fabricated.

final_result.explanation: The internal and external validation both strongly indicate that the original caption is completely fabricated and out of context. The internal check analyzes the image and caption, finding no connection between Katy Perry's appearance and the claim about her statement on human flesh.  The confidence score of 10 reflects this certainty. The external check uses Snopes.com, a reputable fact-checking website, to confirm that the quote is entirely false and part of a false news report. The confidence score of 10 from the external check further strengthens the conclusion. There is complete agreement between the internal and external checks, leaving no room for doubt or uncertainty.  The image shows Katy Perry at an event, and there's nothing in her expression or the image context that suggests anything related to cannibalism or the quoted statement. The visual evidence directly supports the conclusion that the caption is entirely false and out of context.  There is no visual tampering or miscontextualization.  The analysis is based solely on the image itself and the readily available evidence confirming the falsity of the news report. There is no discrepancy between the internal and external checks; both consistently point towards the caption being completely fabricated and unrelated to the image. The high confidence score reflects the robust evidence supporting the conclusion. Therefore, it is definitively concluded that the caption is out of context.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validations confirm that the caption is completely fabricated and bears no relation to the image.  Snopes.com debunks the claim, and the image shows no evidence to support the claim.
